did.abstract: Memoranda and reports relating to Allied World War II policy planning for the post-war period. Digital copies of select records also available at https://digitalcollections.hoover.org.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research. Digital copies of select records also available at https://digitalcollections.hoover.org.

The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items, computer media, and digital files. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos, films, or digital files during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Rear admiral, United States Navy; member of the secretariat, State-War-Navy Coordinating Committee, 1945-1947.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Memoranda and reports relating to Allied World War II policy planning for the post-war period.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Formerly security-classified records of the U.S. government, released in full or in part. Arranged chronologically by date of release by Hoover, thereunder chronologically by date of creation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The two declassified documents both relate to the status of papers written about post-war issues in Europe and Asia and are titled as follows: "State-War-Navy Coordinating Committee: Status of Papers," 20 November 1945; and "Status of Informal Clearances," 28 November 1945.
